definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Da Yuan Dayitongzhi, Yuan dynasty geographical encyclopedia, compiled 1285-1294 under Jamal al-Din 紮馬剌丁|扎马剌丁 and Yu Yinglong 虞應龍|虞应龙, 755 scrolls

sentences.english: Yet the process of telling a story doesn't have to be unidirectional.
sentences.chinese: 然而講故事的程式並不需要大一統。

sentences.english: The first legacy is the concept of “Great Unity” so entrenched in Chinese people’s minds.
sentences.chinese: 首先是深入人心的中華民族“大一統”觀念。
第一章涉及的是“大一統”問題。

definition: centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties/generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui
dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucians (slogan of the Former Han dynasty)
literary inquisition/official persecution of intellectuals for their writing
to engage in wars of aggression at will (idiom)/militaristic/bellicose
